definition[0]: to make an official agreement to do something
example[0]: Some local authorities have entered into partnership with private companies.
note[0]: enter into an agreement/contract etc with
definition[1]: to start discussing or dealing with something
example[1]: It could be a problem, but we don’t need to enter into that just yet.
example[2]: The government refused to enter into discussions with the opposition.
definition[2]: to affect a situation and be something that you consider when you make a choice
example[3]: He always buys the best – money doesn’t enter into it.
definition[3]: to take part in a game, party etc in an eager way
definition[4]: to officially make an agreement, contract etc
example[4]: When we entered into a sponsorship agreement with the Rugby World Cup Limited, no one believed that the event would be such an outstanding success.
